meanings.definition: A person who seeks to convert others to the Christian faith, especially by public preaching.
meanings.sent1: The evangelists spoke passionately about their beliefs in the town square.
meanings.sent2: The group of evangelists gathered every Sunday to share their message.
meanings.sent3: The evangelists decided to have a friendly competition to see who could spread the word the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like evangelists, spreading hope and kindness wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The image of the evangelists preaching under the open sky stayed with him for years.

meanings.definition: A zealous advocate of a particular cause.
meanings.sent1: As an environmental evangelist, she tirelessly campaigned for a greener planet.
meanings.sent2: The animal rights evangelists protested outside the factory, demanding change.
meanings.sent3: The fashion evangelists declared that polka dots were the new trend of the season.
meanings.sent4: His passion for education made him an evangelist for literacy in his community.
meanings.sent5: The evangelists of equality fought for justice with unwavering determination.
